title: Texas To Hold First Execution Since Botched Oklahoma Case
teaser: Robert James Campbell is scheduled to be killed by capital punishment today.
contentencoded:
Today, the state of Texas is scheduled to execute 41-year old Robert James Campbell for the murder and rape of a 20-year old woman in 1991.

If carried out, Campbell will be the first prisoner killed by capital punishment in the U.S. since a botched execution occurred in Oklahoma two weeks ago. However, Campbellâ€™s defense team is still trying to appeal his deal using two very distinct arguments.

NPR correspondent Wade Goodwyn joins Here & Now’s Robin Young to discuss these arguments, and to talk about why this particular execution is both controversial and significant.

Guest

  • Wade Goodwyn, NPR national desk correspondent in Dallas.
